intro: Justicia vagabunda var. laxiflora, commonly known as the laxiflora false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by birds and insects, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain numerous seeds.
